p: Antibacterial efficacies of the metabolite 339 were determined by serial dilution assay. Compound 339 showed strong activity against Bacillus subtilis and Micrococcus luteus with MIC values of 8.33 µg/mL and 16.66 µg/mL, respectively, while the MIC values of Oxytetracyclin used as the positive control against Bacillus subtilis and Micrococcus luteus were 4.16 µg/mL and 0.40 µg/mL, respectively. While the MIC value of compound C ( Figure 13) against Mucor hiemalis (16.66 µg/mL) was the same as that of nystatin used as positive control. The two active metabolites are anthranilic acid derivatives with a phenylethyl core. Since metabolite 340, which contains a phenylmethyl group instead of a phenylethyl residue, was not active, it was concluded that the phenylethyl moiety in compounds 339 and C is essential for their antimicrobial activity [ 60].
